Package edu.cornell.gdiac.physics.obstacle

Class PolygonObstacle

java.lang.Object
edu.cornell.gdiac.physics.obstacle.Obstacle
edu.cornell.gdiac.physics.obstacle.SimpleObstacle
edu.cornell.gdiac.physics.obstacle.PolygonObstacle
Direct Known Subclasses:
WallModel
public class PolygonObstacle extends SimpleObstacle
Arbitrary polygonal-shaped model to support collisions. The polygon coordinates are all in local space, relative to the object center. In addition the texture coordinates are computed automatically from the texture size, using the same policy as PolygonSpriteBatch.

  • Constructor Details

    • PolygonObstacle

      public PolygonObstacle(float[] points)
      Creates a (not necessarily convex) polygon at the origin. The points given are relative to the polygon's origin. They are measured in physics units. They tile the image according to the drawScale (which must be set for drawing to work properly).
      Parameters:
      points - The polygon vertices

    • PolygonObstacle

      public PolygonObstacle(float[] points, float x, float y)
      Creates a (not necessarily convex) polygon The points given are relative to the polygon's origin. They are measured in physics units. They tile the image according to the drawScale (which must be set for drawing to work properly).
      Parameters:
      points - The polygon vertices
      x - Initial x position of the polygon center
      y - Initial y position of the polygon center

  • Method Details

    • getDimension

      public com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 getDimension()
      Returns the dimensions of this box This method does NOT return a reference to the dimension vector. Changes to this vector will not affect the shape. However, it returns the same vector each time its is called, and so cannot be used as an allocator.
      Returns:
      the dimensions of this box

    • setDimension

      public void setDimension(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 value)
      Sets the dimensions of this box This method does not keep a reference to the parameter.
      Parameters:
      value - the dimensions of this box

    • initShapes

      protected void initShapes(float[] points)
      Initializes the Box2d shapes for this polygon If the texture is not null, this method also allocates the PolygonRegion for drawing. However, the points in the polygon region may be rescaled later.
      Parameters:
      points - The polygon vertices

    • trimColinear

      protected void trimColinear(float[] points, com.badlogic.gdx.utils.ShortArray indices)
      Removes colinear vertices from the given triangulation. For some reason, the LibGDX triangulator will occasionally return colinear vertices.
      Parameters:
      points - The polygon vertices
      indices - The triangulation indices

    • resize

      Resize this polygon (stretching uniformly out from origin)
      Parameters:
      width - The new width
      height - The new height

    • setTexture

      public void setTexture(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion value)
      Sets the object texture for drawing purposes. In order for drawing to work properly, you MUST set the drawScale. The drawScale converts the physics units to pixels.
      Overrides:
      setTexture in class SimpleObstacle
      Parameters:
      value - the object texture for drawing purposes.

    • setDrawScale

      public void setDrawScale(float x, float y)
      Sets the drawing scale for this physics object The drawing scale is the number of pixels to draw before Box2D unit. Because mass is a function of area in Box2D, we typically want the physics objects to be small. So we decouple that scale from the physics object. However, we must track the scale difference to communicate with the scene graph. We allow for the scaling factor to be non-uniform.
      Overrides:
      setDrawScale in class Obstacle
      Parameters:
      x - the x-axis scale for this physics object
      y - the y-axis scale for this physics object

    • draw

      public void draw(GameCanvas canvas)
      Draws the physics object.
      Overrides:
      draw in class SimpleObstacle
      Parameters:
      canvas - Drawing context

    • drawDebug

      public void drawDebug(GameCanvas canvas)
      Draws the outline of the physics body. This method can be helpful for understanding issues with collisions.
      Specified by:
      drawDebug in class Obstacle
      Parameters:
      canvas - Drawing context
